game.model

Class Clock

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • game.model.Clock

  • public class Clock
extends java.util.Observable
    A simple Chess Clock.
    Author:
    Andreas Nylund, Hanna Granholm

    • Constructor Detail

      • Clock

        public Clock(java.awt.event.ActionListener controller)
        Constructor for the clock.

        The specified actionlistener will listen for the clock ticks.

        Parameters:
        controller -

    • Method Detail

      • startClock

        public void startClock()
        Starts the clock.

      • addTime

        public void addTime(int currentTurn)
        The clock ticks, preferably called by the actionlistener on each action event.

        The specified color specifies which player is currently playing and adds time to his/her clock.

        Parameters:
        currentTurn - The current player's color.

      • getTurn

        public int getTurn()
        Returns the player currently making a move.
        Returns:
        Color of player currently making a move.

      • getTime

        public java.sql.Time[] getTime()
        A method for reading the time elapsed from the clock.

        The returned array is ordered after color. time[ChessLogic.WHITE] being white time elapsed etc.

        Returns:
        An array of time elapsed for each player.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the clock to zero.

      • stopClock

        public void stopClock()
        Stops the clock.
